notesStmt.note: Much damaged. Some leaves restored (stuck on modern paper). Worm-eaten. Defective at the end.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A fragment of a polemic treatise against the Rabbanite code of laws as laid down in Maimonides' Mishneh Torah.

collation.p: 10 quires of 10 leaves each, marked with Hebrew letters on the upper right-hand corner at the beginning of each quire, and with Arabic numerals on the upper left-hand corners. The numeration of quires starts with no. 5, which indicates that the first four quires, together with the first leaf of the fifth quire are missing.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental semi-cursive script of the 15th to 16th century.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Karaite tract. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2522.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882: inscribed, [110v].
